intro: Canthium lanceolatum, commonly known as the lanceleaf spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub with lance-shaped leaves and produces small, greenish-yellow flowers. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that release seeds when mature. Canthium lanceolatum is often found in disturbed habitats and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
